intro: Rubus jastrzebowskli, commonly known as the Jastrzebowski blackberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubus genus, which includes many species of shrubs commonly referred to as blackberries or raspberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. The botanical features of this plant include its compound leaves, thorny stems, and aggregate fruits.
